conclusion: To determine the output power and total power of the power source when connected with the small light bulb, analyze the U-I graph.
The line (A) represents the U-I graph of the power source.
The curve (B) represents the U-I graph of the small light bulb.
The intersection of line (A) and curve (B) indicates the operating point where the power source and light bulb are connected in series.
The intersection occurs at U = 2 V and I = 2 A.
Calculate output power: P_output = U_load × I = 2 V × 2 A = 4 W.
From the graph, the total voltage of the power source at I = 2 A is 3 V.
Calculate total power: P_total = U_total × I = 3 V × 2 A = 6 W.
Output Power of the Power Source: 4 W, Total Power of the Power Source: 6 W.
